intro: Kentiopsis luciani, commonly known as the silverleaf kentiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Kentiopsis luciani is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
